banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Investments in the future: A new approach to foreign aid
videoData.socialTitle: Investments in the future: A new approach to foreign aid

nodes.whoTheyAre: Paul O'Connell is president and partner of FDO Partners, LLC, an investment management and research firm currently managing US$2.3 billion. FDO is a joint venture partner with State Street Associates. A native of Ireland, O'Connell has a B.A. from Trinity College, Dublin, and a Ph.D. in Economics from Harvard University. He’s also written and published many articles on global finance and capital allocation topics. And he serves as a director of the GAVI Campaign, which works to expand access to immunization, and chairs its Board.

videoData.description: Poor countries need support in order to advance, but there are limits to how much aid can be gifted. How can developed nations encourage long-term help on a grand scale? Financial economist Paul O'Connell proposes a radical approach: enlist private investors to take on the challenge of high-impact causes in developing countries, such as expanding vaccination access in Nigeria. The dividends will pay out on a global scale.
